author: Special Correspondent
text:
The arid district with larger number of waterbodies continued to be the most preferred destination for terrestrial and migratory birds as the forest personnel spotted tens of hundreds of birds in bird sanctuaries and select waterbodies as they launched the two-day Tamil Nadu wetland synchronised bird census on Friday.

Birds flocked Therthangal, Sakkarakottai, Big tank, Kanjirankulam, Chitrangudi, Melaselvanoor, Keelaselvanoor sanctuaries in good numbers, thanks to good inflow of water after northeast monsoon.

Three census teams led by forest personnel and comprising bird watchers and volunteers from schools and colleges began the census on Friday morning after M. Ravi and A. Charles Navin from Madurai-based ‘Iragugal Naturalists Association,’ a Non-Governmental Organisation briefed the students about the transect method for surveying birds and identifying species.
title: Wetland synchronised bird census begins
